comment._content: Very dapper looking gent. It clearly wasn't fashionable to smile in your wedding snaps back then!

comment.author: 20727502@N00
comment._content: Poole's studio were clearly very conscientious about offering subjects a rug or matting or similar for outdoor group shots. Wonder whether the photographer(s) lugged them around - or were people constantly dragging living room carpets out into the driveway :)

comment.author: 43516234@N03
comment._content: There's a story there - very lovely.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Some census digging suggests that the lady's name is Mary, that in January 1908 they were 30 and 26 or thereabouts, and that James was a grocer and spirit merchant. Here is James Ryan, 24, of "Pike Street" (a transcription error), in 1901. I think this is him with his wife Mary in 1911, although it states that they are married 7 years. However, their only children in 1911 are 1 and 2, consistent with a 1908 wedding.
